title: Orange Date Muffins
ingredients: 1 orange; grate the rind as fine as possible, then chop up the orange itself and reserve it
½ cup pitted and chopped dates
1 stick (½ cup) unsalted butter, cut into bits and softened
instructions: Remove the rind from 1 orange, chop it, and reserve it.  Remove and discard the pith of the orange, quarter it, and seed it.  Blend the rind, the orange quarters, ½ cup each of orange juice and chopped and pitted dates, the butter, and the egg until the mixture is combined well.  Transfer to a large bowl in which the flour has been sifted with the other dry ingredients.

Into this bowl sift together the flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt.  Add the orange mixture and stir the batter until it is just combined.  (The batter should be lumpy.)  Spoon the batter into 16 buttered muffin tins, filling them two-thirds full, and bake the muffins in a preheated hot oven (400° F.) for 15 to 20 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
Source:  A Medley of Muffins by Sylvia Ewasew, Gourmet Magazine, October 1981.
